item.title: Marks & Spencer breach linked to Scattered Spider ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Ongoing outages at British retail giant Marks & Spencer are caused by a ransomware attack believed to be conducted by a hacking collective known as "Scattered Spider" BleepingComputer has learned from multiple sources. [...]

item.title: Hitachi Vantara takes servers offline after Akira ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Hitachi Vantara, a subsidiary of Japanese multinational conglomerate Hitachi, was forced to take servers offline over the weekend to contain an Akira ransomware attack. [...]

item.title: VeriSource now says February data breach impacts 4 million people
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Employee benefits administration firm VeriSource Services is warning that a data breach exposed the personal information of four million people. [...]

item.title: Over 1,200 SAP NetWeaver servers vulnerable to actively exploited flaw
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 1,200 internet-exposed SAP NetWeaver instances are vulnerable to an actively exploited maximum severity unauthenticated file upload vulnerability that allows attackers to hijack servers. [...]

item.title: Kali Linux warns of update failures after losing repo signing key
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Offensive Security warned Kali Linux users to manually install a new Kali repository signing key to avoid experiencing update failures. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Outlook on the web search issues, failures
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is working on fully mitigating issues causing Outlook on the web and SharePoint Online users to experience delays or failures when searching. [...]

item.title: Cloudflare mitigates record number of DDoS attacks in 2025
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Internet services giant Cloudflare says it mitigated a record number of DDoS attacks in 2024, recording a massive 358% year-over-year jump and a 198% quarter-over-quarter increase. [...]

item.title: Coinbase fixes 2FA log error making people think they were hacked
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Coinbase has fixed a confusing bug in its account activity logs that caused users to think their credentials were compromised. [...]

item.title: Brave's Cookiecrumbler tool taps community to help block cookie notices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Brave has open-sourceed a new tool called "Cookiecrumbler," which uses large language models (LLMs) to detect cookie consent notices and then community-driven reviews to block those that won't break site functionality. [...]

item.title: DragonForce expands ransomware model with white-label branding scheme
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: The ransomware scene is re-organizing, with one gang known as DragonForce working to gather other operations under a cartel-like structure. [...]

item.title: WooCommerce admins targeted by fake security patches that hijack sites
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A large-scale phishing campaign targets WooCommerce users with a fake security alert urging them to download a "critical patch" that adds a Wordpress backdoor to the site. [...]

item.title: Windows 11's Recall AI is now rolling out on Copilot+ PCs
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed that Windows Recall is rolling out to everyone with Windows 11 KB5055627 on Copilot+ PCs. [...]
